intro: Tetrariopsis octandra, commonly known as the eight-angled tetrariopsis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
